availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Philip Winkler (Jefferson County, KY, grocer & flour dealer)

body.p: Jefferson County, KY, retail grocer and flour dealer. Native of Baden. Married to Rosina Winkler. Father of Edward Winkler, Charles Winkler, George Winkler, Mary Elizabeth Winkler, Rosa Winkler, William Fred Winkler, Andrew P. Winkler, Henry A. Winkler, and Katie R. Winkler. Grocer in Louisville in 1850. Retail grocer in Louisville in 1859. Storekeeper in Louisville in 1860. Employed Augusta Waliver as a servant in Louisville in 1860. Signed a petition as a dealer in flour in May 1861 to appoint W. G. Timberlake as flour inspector.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, District 2, p. 227A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville Ward 3, p. 622.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville Ward 5, p. 533B.
Henry Tanner, ed., The Louisville Directory and Business Advertiser for 1859-60 (Louisville: Maxwell & Co., 1859), 249, 284.
Find A Grave, "Philip Winkler (unknown-1871)," Memorial 121925829, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/121925829 (accessed January 24, 2020).
KYR-0001-017-0163.
